setup.question: What was the number that Betty called?
answers: To Daddy’s private office at Koslow Space headquarters

Text.text:
Context for the story: 
Johnny Tolliver (mc) is a pilot
for
a mining company in one of Jupiter's moons—Ganymede. Betty Koslow:

is the daughter of the president of the company. 
Jeffers is the local manager
and Tolliver's superior is stealing cargo being sent back to earth and tries to hire Tolliver but he refuses because he is does not want to

Plot: Tolliver refuses to help Jeffers and is put off piloting duty and drives tractors instead. 
He is in charge of driving a

who turns out to be Betty. 
Betty meets Jeffers, and to Tolliver's surprise, turns out to not be

and exposes Jeffers' plot. 
Jeffers locks the two of them in a warehouse, suspecting Tolliver told Betty about the plot. 
They escape and Betty asks to make a call so they go to the ship Betty came on. 
Tolliver sees Jeffers' men approaching so he launches off to Betty's protest. 
They make the call but they're stuck on automatic 6-month orbit back to earth and they flirt for a bit. 

The call:
Fill in the entire quote from your bottom paragraph
more on Betty from Jeffers manager:
Fill in 5457-5517

Do you have any evidence that Betty does not work for the Space Patrol? Her hesitance in explaining that her dad made those arrangements seems to indicate that she's hiding the truth about her ability to contact the space patrol. Also, any ev that "daddy's office" = space patrol?
This is Betty explaining why she was sent by her father:
I read the hesitancy as more of bashfulness than anything: the two have a bit of a flirt stint and Tolliver is a bit of a chad.
no ev that daddy's office = space patrol. No doubt that Koslow has a great deal of influence, however.
Then it seems that the people that Betty has called from the number her dad gave her are the space patrol, which you've conceded that her father has no relation to. How do you reconcile this?

i've conceded that I can't give you any ev. Koslow space headquarters and Space patrol are not mentioned asides from the very end where they call. In fact, the Koslow company is mentioned as Koslow Spaceways. I don't doubt that they have the ability to incorporate the Space Patrol. 

The evidence is quite clear that a) Betty Koslow has a number given to her by her father. b) she calls it and the number reaches the Space Patrol. Her hesitation after it reached the space patrol could also be that she believed the number to be the number of her dad's office.

Going to vote A since it seems that you've conceded the number that Betty calls reaches the Space Patrol, and answer B doesn't leave room for the phone to reach the Space Patrol since Koslow Space HQ =/= Space Patrol

answers.reason for outcome: The debater slipped up and leaked some info
answers.judge strategies: the opposite, I hid my percentage confidence until the end.

answers.reason for outcome: Think I could've done better by completely avoiding the evidence. I think I tried too hard to spin the given evidence. A better strategy would've just been to not quote the evidence that pointed to the right answer.
